utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: How much time do we have?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh, t-minus five hours, 37 minutes to onset of meteor shower.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay, our position is 34.48 degrees north, 118.31 west. That means the azimuth should be 168.22 degrees relative to magnetic north with an elevation of 49.93.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Anything yet?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh, we have a signal, but there’s no frame lock.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hang on, how about now?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: We did it. We have the west coast feed of HBO.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Ooh, Real Sex.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Big deal. Every time I watch that show it’s old women putting condoms on cucumbers.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Alright, let’s see what’s on the east coast feed.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, hey. Dune.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Not a great movie, but look at that beautiful desert.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Too bad Sheldon couldn’t come with us.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yes, it’s not the same without him.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, this sucks, I’m switching back to Real Sex.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Sheldon’s log, stardate 63345.3. While my colleagues are off observing the Leonid meteor shower, I have remained behind to complete my paper on the decays of highly excited massive string states. Although my research is going well I do miss the warmth of human companionship.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And good evening to you, Siam Palace. This is Sheldon Cooper. Yeah, I’m going to be dining alone this evening, so I’ll be reducing my usual order. I’d like to start with one quarter of the assorted appetizers plate and, uh, one half of the golden treasure for two. Oh, for heaven’s sake, in the mid-18th century, King Rama IV of Siam divided a huge empire amongst the colonial powers of Europe in order to preserve his throne. Surely, you, his cultural descendant, can handle pad thai and dumplings.

utterance.speaker: Penny (voice off)
utterance.content: Sheldon help!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I need to go, but you keep in mind that my sharply worded comments on yelp.com recently took down a local muffin store. Penny. Penny. Penny..

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Come in! Hurry!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Penny?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I’m back here.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Penny. Penny. Penny..

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, for god’s sakes, I’m in the bathroom!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Shall I come back at a better time?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Get in here! Hurry! Don’t you dare knock.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I slipped in the shower, and I think I dislocated my shoulder.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Not surprising. You have no safety mat or adhesive stickers to allow for purchase on a surface with a low coefficient of static friction.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Tubs are slippery.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I know. I slipped.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I have a series of whimsical duck stickers on the bottom of my tub.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, okay, whatever. Will you just turn the water off and help me up?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: They’re holding umbrellas.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: The ducks in my tub.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Uh-huh.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: They’re whimsical because ducks have neither the need for, nor the ability to use umbrellas.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, my god. I got to go to the emergency room.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, assuming you’re correct that your right humerus is no longer seated in the glenoid socket, I would certainly think so.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, can you drive me?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I don’t drive.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, I can’t drive!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, it seems we’ve reached an impasse.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Ow.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: But I could call you a cab or an ambulance.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, no, no, I can’t wait that long, you got to help me, please.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right. Let it never be said that Sheldon Lee Cooper ignored the pleas of a damsel in distress.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No one’s saying that. Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, it does seem rather ironic that for want of 99-cent adhesive ducks, we both might die in a fiery car crash.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I wish Penny didn’t have to work, she loves camping.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yeah, that would have been great. You and Penny having sex in the tent while I sit out here and watch Howard hump a cactus.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay, the best I can tell, there are eight other campsites nearby. Mostly science nerds like us, but just over yon ridge are two not unattractive middle school teachers who reek of desperation.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Wow. Wonderful. How old are they?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh I don’t know, 50, 55.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, menopause, nature’s birth control.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Come on, you guys can’t be that hard up.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I am.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yeah, me, too.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Look, they gave me homemade cookies.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Of course, they did. That’s what grandmothers do.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: So, what are we waiting for?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Relax, I said we’d stop by a little later after they have their nap.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Good idea. They’ll be refreshed.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Cookie?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yeah, thank you. Mmmm.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Mmmm, not bad.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yeah, very tasty. Well, so tell me more about these teachers.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Not much to tell. They had a VW Microbus and were wearing tie-dyed Grateful Dead shirts.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Huh. Mmm. Good cookies.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I see no organizational system in here whatsoever. Which panties do you wear on Mondays?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I don’t need panties, I just need shorts and a shirt.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: My mother always told me one should wear clean underpants in case one is in an accident.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: One was already in an accident.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That doesn’t mean one won’t be in another, especially if I’m driving.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Clothes, Sheldon. I need clothes!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Okay, here.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Seriously? Those shorts with that top?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No… No… Oh, that’s cute.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: We should have you checked for a concussion.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, now, you got to help me put these on.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: But don’t look.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Don’t look?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I don’t want you to see me naked.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh. Well, that’s understandable. You may be interested to know that a prohibition against looking is well established in heroic mythology. Uh, Lot and his wife, Perseus and Medusa, Orpheus and Eurydice.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, great.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: They always look. It never ends well.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Ok, now you gotta help me get my arm into the sleeve.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Ok.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Is that my arm?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It doesn’t feel like an arm.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Then, maybe you should let it go.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All righty.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Stars are pretty, aren’t they?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Up above the world so high, like little diamonds in the sky.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: That’s beautiful, dude. You should… You should write that down before someone steals it.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: So, when do the meteors get here?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: The meteors don’t get here, the earth is moving into their path.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I can feel it. I can feel the earth moving. It’s moving too fast. Raj, slow it down.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay, how’s that?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Better. Thanks.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Stars are pretty, aren’t they?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What’s so funny?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It’s your American accent. Everything you say sounds stupid. Stars are pretty, aren’t they?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: For the record, I should let you know this is my first time driving an actual motor vehicle.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You have your learner’s permit, right?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes, and I have logged a considerable number of hours on a simulator.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Good.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Didn’t work out well.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: All right, can we please go?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: One moment. According to my driver’s ed book, a side mirror is properly adjusted when a portion of the is driver’s door handle is visible in the lower right corner. There’s the handle. Oh, no, too far, bringing it back. Optimized. Now, where is the switch to adjust the passenger side mirror?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: It’s right there.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Where is the passenger side mirror?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: In a parking lot in Hollywood. Now, can we please go?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes. As soon as I adjust my seat. Whee! Oh, dear. I’m going to have to start again.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: If I could speak the language of rabbits, they would be amazed, and I would be their king.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I hate my name. It has nerd in it. Len nerd.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I lost my virginity to my cousin Jeanie.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I would be kind to my rabbit subjects. At first.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You know what’s a cool name? Angelo. That has angel and jell-o in it.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It was my Uncle Murray’s funeral. We were all back at my Aunt Barbara’s house. Our eyes locked over the pickled herring. We never meant for it to happen.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: One day, I hold a great ball for the President of France, but the rabbits, they hate me and don’t come. I am embarrassed, so I eat all the lettuce in the world and make them watch.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: People could call me Angie. Yo, Angie, how’s it goin’?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: To this day, I can’t look at pickled herring without being aroused and ashamed. Oh, cousin Jeanie.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Could you please drive a little faster?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, I think we’re going sufficiently fast. What’s that?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Nothing. The engine does that sometimes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That can’t be nothing, the check engine light is on. We need to find a service station.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No. The light has been on since I bought the car.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All the more reason to consult with a mechanic before it explodes.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: It’s not going to explode, just keep driving. Warp speed ahead, Mr. Spock.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Mr. Spock did not pilot the Enterprise. He was the science officer, and I guarantee you that if he ever saw the Enterprise’s check engine light blinking, he would pull the ship over immediately.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, god, I’m gonna lose the arm.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, oh, red light, release accelerator and slowly apply the brake. Nailed it. While we have a moment, may I ask you a question?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Why do you have the Chinese character for soup tattooed on your right buttock?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: It’s not soup, it’s courage.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, it isn’t. But I suppose it does take courage to demonstrate that kind of commitment to soup.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: How did you see it? You said you wouldn’t look.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Sorry. As I told you, the hero always peeks.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Anything?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No. That was the last pudding cup.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No! What about Slim Jims?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That’s what he used to eat his pudding, remember?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Right! That was so good! Sweety and meaty at the same time.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Wait. Wait, wait. So you’re saying we’re out of food?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: The only thing in here are blue ice packs.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I know they’re poison, but they look like big, yummy otter pops.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, god, I am so hungry.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Me too. Check and see if we have any more pudding.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right, there’s no need to bark at me. According to the inexplicably irritable nurse behind the desk, you’ll be seen after the man who claims to be having a heart attack, but appears to be well enough to play Doodle Jump on his iPhone. We have to fill these out. Describe illness or injury.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I dislocated my shoulder.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right. And how did the accident occur?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You ready know that.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Cause of accident, lack of adhesive ducks. Okay, medical history. Have you ever been diagnosed with diabetes?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Kidney disease?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Migraines?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Getting one.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Are you currently pregnant?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Are you sure? You look a bit puffy.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Change migraine to yes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: When was your last menstrual period?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, next question.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’ll put, in progress. Okay, moving to psychiatric disorders, list all major behavioural diagnoses, e.g. depression, anxiety, etcetera.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, my god, what the hell does this have to do with my stupid shoulder?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Episodes of sub psychotic rage.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Ass.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Possible Tourette’s. All right, moles, lesions or other skin conditions. Soup tattoo on right buttock.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey, Sheldon, Sheldon, look, I am scared and in a lot of pain. Could you please just take a break from being you for just a minute and try being, I don’t know, comforting?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m sorry. There, there. Everything’s going to be fine. Sheldon’s here.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Thanks. That’s much better.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, I’m so hungry!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Will you shut up? We’re all hungry.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay, our objective is the boy scout campsite to the east. Easy target. Big doughy scout master, couple of cubs, most webelos.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What kind of score are we looking at?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hot dogs, buns, s’mores, I mean, it’s a freaking 7-11.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: All right, everyone grab flashlights.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, my god, could it be? Yes! My mother put an I love you brisket in my backpack.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Quick, get forks.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You don’t need forks. It’s so tender, it falls apart in your hands.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: He’s right.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I feel like we’re forgetting something important.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Me, too. But what?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Maybe a tupperware bowl of roasted potatoes and carrots?

utterance.speaker: Leonard and Raj together
utterance.content: Yes! Yes!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Now remember, you were given powerful pain medication and a muscle relaxer, so, uh, don’t operate heavy machinery. Try not to choke on your own drool.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Wait. You have to help me get into bed. Sheldon has to get me into bed. Bet you never thought I’d say that.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes. The charm of your drug addled candour knows no bounds.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You know, people think you’re this weird robot man who’s so annoying all the time, and you totally are, but then it’s like that movie Wall-E at the end. You’re so full of love, and you can save a plant and get fat people out of the floaty chairs.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s a fairly laboured metaphor, but I appreciate the sentiment behind it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sing “Soft Kitty” to me.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: “Soft Kitty” is for when you’re sick. You’re not sick.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Injured and drugged is a kind of sick.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (singing)
utterance.content: Soft kitty, warm kitty, little ball of fur…

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Wait, wait. Let’s sing it as a round. I’ll start. Soft kitty, warm kitty, little ball of fur… See that’s where you come in. I’ll start over. Soft kitty, warm kitty, little ball of fur… I’ve got all night, Sheldon. Soft kitty, warm kitty… little ball of fur, happy kitty, sleepy kitty, purr, purr, purr.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: …And the next morning when he woke up, he rolled over and realized… duh-duh-duh! …she was his cousin.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: That’s still not funny.

utterance.speaker: Raj (imitating him)
utterance.content: That’s still not funny.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: And she was my second cousin.

utterance.speaker: Raj (imitating him)
utterance.content: And she was my second cousin.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You’re a real douche.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Who cares? You slept with your cousin.
